intro: Tylophora adnata, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has opposite, simple leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Tylophora adnata is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
